content.description: Not a great route but a decent warm up; climb past a somewhat sketchy wedged flake and follow a broken crack to a ledge. Leave the ledge, climbing a corner crack with various jams past some more questionable rock to a big ledge and chain anchors.
content.protection: Double set from tips to fist-sized cams.
content.location: This is the first route you come to when approaching the wall, the anchors aren't obvious but the route is plaqued.

content.description:
The route follows a left-facing mostly hands corner for about 40 feet to a ledge with stacked blocks and a two-bolt anchor. There is a short wide pod in the middle of the corner. Sporty moves on fractured rock lead to the summit, then downclimb back to the ledge with bolted anchor. Expect 5.10 moves both in the crack and above the bolts.

The FA was on Martin Luther King Day (1/18) 2016.
content.protection:
Rack: (1) #.75, (1) #1, (2) #2, (1) #4, (1) #6

IMPORTANT: I left a cord and quicklink around the summit blocks as mental pro for the downclimb back to the bolted anchor. I did not weight the cord, so proceed with caution above the bolts, both on the way up and down!
content.location: The tower is located about 40' to the right of Unnamed #10 in K3's book, on the left side of Windy Ridge. The route climbs the south side of the tower.

content.description: A nice erratic splitter crack with pretty good rock. Climb a a couple of body lengths of tips, features appear keeping the climbing moderate. Move through an offset section of off-fingers which quickly turns to a long section of mostly hands before becoming offset and pinching down to fingers again. Chain anchors.
content.location: Located 50 ft to the left of Ugly Betty and just around the corner from Bass Akwards.

content.description: For such a short route this thing packs a punch. Wedge yourself into the shallow chimney and jam and grovel your way up. Theres a nice crack in the back which starts as thin hands and pinches down to tips as the chimney pinches shut. Exit the chimney onto a small ledge with chain anchors.
content.protection: A single set from thin hands down to tips should suffice.
content.location: Located about 30ft to the left of Ugly Betty.
